channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Yet more rubbish dumped here., 22nd March
item.description:
On Wednesday night a black bag of rubbish was added to this weeks’ pile. This was followed by a white wicker storage unit on Thursday night. Please do something about this constant issue.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Alstone Lane, Alstone, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Numerous potholes in road and uneven pavement, 22nd March
item.description:
Pavement worst at Griffiths Avenue end of Chad Road. We struggle to push a wheelchair along this pavement every Sunday taking resident(s) from the Granleys Care Home to St Marks Church. This problem and the potholes have been like this for years.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4a;4b, Chad Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Accident waiting to happen!, 22nd March
item.description:
Although this has been reported by many here and on local groups I want to also highlight the danger the ‘traffic calming’ has caused. Twice now we’ve been involved in near misses. The ‘bollards’ are too close and now with parking either side creating even more standing traffic and pollution, plus road humps and 20mph it really seems unnecessarily excessive and not thought through. Simple double yellow lines and road humps would have done the job far more efficiently (and cheaply!) without the chaos we currently have. Please can the traffic issues be monitored as a matter of urgency?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hatherley Lane, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: No street nameplate to show which houses are in which direction, 22nd March
item.description:
Although there are street nameplates at the bottom of Ridge Grove, once you get to the top of the road there is nothing to tell you that numbers 3, 4, 5 and 6 are to the left and numbers 7, 8 and 9 are to the right. Delivery drivers are constantly getting lost and delivering parcels to the wrong houses as they don't know which house numbers are in which direction. Other streets have signs saying which house numbers are in which direction so can we please have the same?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bluebell Crescent, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ivor Williams Trailer left half on road/half on pavement for 6 mths, 22nd March
item.description:
The owners of one of the new bungalows on Westbury Road have left their trailer parked half on and half off the pavement nowhere near their own residence. The trailer has effectively been abandoned. It has been abandoned opposite No 44 Westbury Road causing a constant obstruction to all traffic on the road but in particular to the owner of No 44 and their relatives/friends entering and existing their own driveway. It is a narrow, residential and circular street with blind bends. The trailer has not been moved/used for at least 6 months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 23, Westbury Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Approaching the roundabout by brizen field from Shurdington road, 22nd March
item.description:
This particular pot hole is about 1.5mtrs long and 300 wide just as your approaching the roundabout from Shurdington road to go to up Hatherley way. This would definitely have someone of their motorcycle if they hit it in the dark. It is bad enough hitting it in a car
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shurdington Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Poor parking on corner, 22nd March
item.description:
I wish to report a vehicle that is often parked on corner of Moorfield Road, Brockworth, Gloucester that is parked causing poor visibility for vehicles driving past Riversmeet flats. There has already been 2 RTC's involving other vehicles (Police called) either due to the obstruction or by drivers not paying attention, either way this is not ideal and the only way to mitigate further issues is for double yellow lines ti be painted. Just to clarify I am NOT reporting an abandoned vehicle.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Moorfield Road, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
